result.execSummary:
All charges against Richard E Pirk in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard E Pirk is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard E Pirk

records.addlTxt: 8:41 AM Defendant Richard E Pirk in court.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley via Zoom, in court for Richard E Pirk.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  The defendant has completed his deferred prosecution agreement.  State moves to dismiss.  BTC: Case dismissed.
Racine County Alternatives Program
for a Zoom appearance

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.** No violent contact with the victim C.C (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
***AMENDED ON 5-6-22:  SCRAM CAN BE REMOVED.***

8:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard E Pirk in court.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court for Richard E Pirk. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Defense files a bond motion.  State does not object to the modification.  This case has been offered deferred prosecution and has a meeting next week to sign the agreement.  BTC: Bond modification granted to removal of the SCRAM unit.
